dt: {bc}a basin-shaped structure in the skeleton of many vertebrates that is formed by the {a_link|pelvic} girdle together with the sacrum and often various coccygeal and caudal vertebrae and that in humans is composed of the two hip bones bounding it on each side and in front while the sacrum and coccyx complete it behind

art.capt: pelvis 1 (human): {it}A{/it} female, {it}B{/it} male, {it}C{/it} right hip bone, {it}D{/it} lateral view, {it}E{/it} medial view; {it}1{/it} sacrum, {it}2{/it} coccyx, {it}3{/it} symphysis, {it}4{/it} ilium, {it}5{/it} pubis, {it}6{/it} ischium, {it}7{/it} acetabulum, {it}8{/it} sacral foramen, {it}9{/it} ischial tuberosity, {it}10{/it} lesser sciatic notch, {it}11{/it} ischial spine, {it}12{/it} greater sciatic notch, {it}13{/it} posterior inferior iliac spine, {it}14{/it} posterior superior iliac spine, {it}15{/it} iliac crest, {it}16{/it} anterior superior iliac spine, {it}17{/it} anterior inferior iliac spine, {it}18{/it} acetabular notch, {it}19{/it} superior ramus of pubis, {it}20{/it} pubic tubercle, {it}21{/it} pubic crest, {it}22{/it} obturator foramen, {it}23{/it} inferior ramus of pubis, {it}24{/it} inferior ramus of ischium, {it}25{/it} iliac fossa, {it}26{/it} articular surface for sacrum, {it}27{/it} sacroiliac joint, {it}28{/it} sacral promontory

shortdef: a basin-shaped structure in the skeleton of many vertebrates that is formed by the pelvic girdle together with the sacrum and often various coccygeal and caudal vertebrae and that in humans is composed of the two hip bones bounding it on each side and in front while the sacrum and coccyx complete it behind

dt: {bc}a pelvis that is abnormally small in one or more principal diameters and that consequently interferes with normal childbirth

shortdef: a pelvis that is abnormally small in one or more principal diameters and that consequently interferes with normal childbirth

dt: {bc}the upper broader portion of the pelvic cavity

shortdef: the upper broader portion of the pelvic cavity —called also false pelvic cavity

dt: {bc}a funnel-shaped structure in each kidney that is formed at one end by the expanded upper portion of the ureter lying in the renal sinus and at the other end by the union of the calyxes of the kidney

art.capt: kidney 1: {it}A{/it} longitudinal section, {it}B{/it} nephron and adjacent blood vessels; {it}1{/it} renal papilla, {it}2{/it} renal column, {it}3{/it} capsule, {it}4{/it} renal pyramid, {it}5{/it} calyx, {it}6{/it} ureter, {it}7{/it} renal pelvis, {it}8{/it} renal vein, {it}9{/it} renal artery, {it}10{/it} interlobar artery, {it}11{/it} arcuate artery, {it}12{/it} interlobular artery, {it}13{/it} interlobar vein, {it}14{/it} cortex, {it}15{/it} interlobular vein, {it}16{/it} renal sinus, {it}17{/it} arcuate vein, {it}18{/it} medulla, {it}19{/it} vasa recta, {it}20{/it} loop of Henle, {it}21{/it} collecting duct, {it}22{/it} arcuate vein, {it}23{/it} arcuate artery, {it}24{/it} proximal convoluted tubule, {it}25{/it} glomerulus, {it}26{/it} Bowman's capsule, {it}27{/it} distal convoluted tubule

shortdef: a funnel-shaped structure in each kidney that is formed at one end by the expanded upper portion of the ureter lying in the renal sinus and at the other end by the union of the calyxes of the kidney

dt: {bc}the lower more contracted part of the pelvic cavity

shortdef: the lower more contracted part of the pelvic cavity —called also true pelvic cavity

dt: {bc}the irregular bony opening bounded by the lower border of the pelvis and closed by muscle and other soft tissues through which the terminal parts of the excretory, reproductive, and digestive systems pass to communicate with the surface of the body

shortdef: the irregular bony opening bounded by the lower border of the pelvis and closed by muscle and other soft tissues through which the terminal parts of the excretory, reproductive, and digestive systems pass to communicate with the surface of the body —called also outlet of the pelvis
